text:
Hi! My company just migrated our web pages to HubSpot, and now we’re looking to migrate our blog over, which is currently in WordPress. Has anyone migrated a blog to HubSpot and KEPT the current URL?

A ticket with HubSpot Chat said we need to change the URL, but we would really like to keep <http://domain.com/blog/|domain.com/blog/> if we can. Would love to hear if others have encountered this, and what worked for them.

you should be able to keep the same url's as /blog/ is very common. You can import your blog straight from wordpress. I recommend reading this - <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/import-your-wordpress-blog-into-HubSpot>

You can connect your domain as <http://blog.domain-name.com|blog.domain-name.com> in HubSpot and then modify its primary domain to be <http://www.domain-name.com|www.domain-name.com>. This way if your blog is named blog in HubSpot, you’ll have your blog posts like this: <http://www.domain-name.com/blog/blog-post-name|www.domain-name.com/blog/blog-post-name>

Cross-posted in General
Can I easily (automatically) move website pages and landing pages (and its theme) from a HS Sandbox, to Production?
